Module Simulator
Package kin.dyn

Class Component

java.lang.Object
kin.dyn.Component
Direct Known Subclasses:
Body, LinearMotorComponent, PassiveElement, Segment, ServoComponent, TConnector, TerminationPoint, TouchPoint, TouchSegment
public abstract class Component
extends java.lang.Object
The abstract upper class of all dynamic components.

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type Field Description

    Create a dynamic component linked to a model component.

  • Constructor Details

    • Component

      public Component​(ComponentModel modelComponent)
      Create a dynamic component linked to a model component.
      Parameters:
      modelComponent - model component

    • Component

      public Component​(Component otherComponent)
      Copy constructor. Note: the reference to the fix-side part is not copied and has to be entered by the caller.
      Parameters:
      otherComponent - object to copy

  • Method Details

    • cloneComponent

      protected abstract Component cloneComponent()
      Create a clone copy of the component.
      Returns:
      clone copy

    • getDescription

      public java.lang.String getDescription()
      Get a description for printing and debugging purpose. If it was not set to the model by the model developer, an automatic string is computed.
      Returns:
      description

    • setBody

      protected void setBody​(Body body)
      Defines the body (dynamic), to which this component belongs to.
      Parameters:
      body - body

    • getBody

      public Body getBody()
      Get the body (dynamic), to which this component belongs to.
      Returns:
      body

    • setFixSidePart

      public void setFixSidePart​(FixSidePart fixSidePart, ConnectionPoint fixSideConnectionPoint)
      Set the fix-side-part. This part can only set once.
      Parameters:
      fixSidePart - fix-side-part
      fixSideConnectionPoint - connection point of the fix-side-part

    • getFixSidePart

      public FixSidePart getFixSidePart()
      Get the fix-side-part, if any.
      Returns:
      fix-side-part

    • getFixSideConnectionPoint

      public ConnectionPoint getFixSideConnectionPoint()
      Get the connection point of the fix-side-part, if any.
      Returns:
      connection point of the fix-side-part

    • getConnectionPoints

      public ConnectionPoint[] getConnectionPoints()
      Get the connection points to the tail-side-parts.
      Returns:
      the connection points of the tail-side-parts

    • getRotoTranslationWorld

      public RotoTranslation getRotoTranslationWorld()
      Get the effective roto-translation of this component in world coordinates.
      Returns:
      effective roto-translation

    • setRotoTranslationWorld

      public void setRotoTranslationWorld​(RotoTranslation rotoTranslationWorld)
      Set the effective roto-translation of this component in world coordinates.
      Parameters:
      rotoTranslationWorld - effective roto-translation

    • getPositionWorld

      public double[] getPositionWorld()
      Return the component's position in world coordinates. This is the same as getRotoTranslationWorld().getTranslation()
      Returns:
      effective current position

    • getHeight

      public double getHeight()
      Return the component's height in world coordinates.
      Returns:
      effective height

    • getRotationWorld

      public double[][] getRotationWorld()
      Return the component's rotation in world coordinates. This is the same as getRotoTranslationWorld().getRotation()
      Returns:
      effective current rotation

    • getAnglesWorld

      public double[] getAnglesWorld()
      Return the component's rotation in world angles, if the rotation is applied in the ordering x-y-plane – x-z-plane – y-z-plane. This is the same as getRotoTranslationWorld().getRotationAngles()
      Returns:
      array of three angles with [0]: angYZ rotation angle in radians in the y-z-plane, [1]: angXZ rotation angle in radians in the x-z-plane, [2]: angXY rotation angle in radians in the x-y-plane

    • getAnglesWorldReverse

      public double[] getAnglesWorldReverse()
      Return the component's rotation in world angles, if the rotation is applied in reverse order (compared to getAnglesWorld()), i.e. if the rotation is applied in the ordering y-z-plane – x-z-plane – x-y-plane. This is the same as getRotoTranslationWorld().getRotationAnglesReverse()
      Returns:
      array of three angles with [0]: angYZ rotation angle in radians in the y-z-plane, [1]: angXZ rotation angle in radians in the x-z-plane, [2]: angXY rotation angle in radians in the x-y-plane

    • getRotoTranslationBodylocal

      public RotoTranslation getRotoTranslationBodylocal()
      Get the effective roto-translation of this component in body-local coordinates.
      Returns:
      effective roto-translation

    • setRotoTranslationBodylocal

      public void setRotoTranslationBodylocal​(RotoTranslation rotoTranslationBodylocal)
      Set the effective roto-translation of this component in body-local coordinates.
      Parameters:
      rotoTranslationBodylocal - effective roto-translation

    • getPositionBodylocal

      public double[] getPositionBodylocal()
      Return the component's position in body-local coordinates. This is the same as getRotoTranslationBodylocal().getTranslation()
      Returns:
      effective current position

    • getRotationBodylocal

      public double[][] getRotationBodylocal()
      Return the component's rotation in body-local coordinates. This is the same as getRotoTranslationBodylocal().getRotation()
      Returns:
      effective current rotation

    • recursivelySetRotoTranslationWorld

      public void recursivelySetRotoTranslationWorld()
      Recusively define all world roto-translations and body-local roto-translations starting from this component.

    • getSynchronizedRotoTranslationsBodylocal

      public static RotoTranslation[] getSynchronizedRotoTranslationsBodylocal​(Component[] components)
      Get all roto-translations for a list of objects. This method is synchronized against the setting of coordinates, thus all coordinates are consistent. This is important, if, e.g. the distances of the respective positions are computed.
      Parameters:
      components - array of components for which the roto-translations should be retrieved
      Returns:
      array of copies of the respective roto-translations

    • getSynchronizedRotoTranslationsWorld

      public static RotoTranslation[] getSynchronizedRotoTranslationsWorld​(Component[] components)
      Get all roto-translations for a list of objects. This method is synchronized against the setting of coordinates, thus all coordinates are consistent. This is important, if, e.g. the distances of the respective positions are computed.
      Parameters:
      components - array of components for which the roto-translations should be retrieved
      Returns:
      array of copies of the respective roto-translations

    • getAllTouchPoints

      public java.util.ArrayList<TouchPoint> getAllTouchPoints()
      Get all TouchPoints from this object and all attached components.
      Returns:
      map that maps a touchpointID to a touchpoint

    • recursivelyGetServos

      public java.util.ArrayList<ServoComponent> recursivelyGetServos()
      Get all servos from this object, including all attached components.
      Returns:
      list of servos

    • recursivelySetDefaultServoAngles

      public void recursivelySetDefaultServoAngles()
      Immediatly set the default servo angles for all servos of this component. It is not reasonable to call this method during a running simulation, as it sets the angles in zero-time, i.e. with infinite speed. This method is only useful to reset a simulation.

    • recursivelyGetMotors

      public java.util.ArrayList<LinearMotorComponent> recursivelyGetMotors()
      Get all motors from this object, including all attached components.
      Returns:
      list of motors

    • recursivelySetDefaultMotorLengths

      public void recursivelySetDefaultMotorLengths()
      Immediatly set the default motor lengths for all servos of this component. It is not reasonable to call this method during a running simulation, as it sets the lengths in zero-time, i.e. with infinite speed. This method is only useful to reset a simulation.

    • recursivelyGetPassiveElements

      public java.util.ArrayList<PassiveElement> recursivelyGetPassiveElements()
      Get all passive elements from this object, including all attached components.
      Returns:
      list of passive elements

    • getAllServos

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​Servo> getAllServos()
      Get all Servos from this object and all attached components.
      Returns:
      map that maps a servoID to a servo

    • getAllLinearMotors

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​LinearMotor> getAllLinearMotors()
      Get all Linear Motors from this object and all attached components.
      Returns:
      map that maps a motorID to a motor

    • getAllFullRotationPassives

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​FullRotationPassive> getAllFullRotationPassives()
      Get all full-rotation passives from this object and all attached components.
      Returns:
      map that maps an ID to a passive component

    • getAllAxisRotationPassives

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​AxisRotationPassive> getAllAxisRotationPassives()
      Get all axis-rotation passives from this object and all attached components.
      Returns:
      map that maps an ID to a passive component

    • getAllLinearPassives

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​LinearPassive> getAllLinearPassives()
      Get all linear passives from this object and all attached components.
      Returns:
      map that maps an ID to a passive component

    • getModelComponent

      public ComponentModel getModelComponent()
      Get the (static) model component of this (dynamic) component.
      Returns:
      model component

    • tickSimulation

      public void tickSimulation​(long deltaMillis)
      Perform the state change as the simulated time proceeds. Usually, a component does not change over time, but e.g. a Servo may drive the motor in target direction.
      Parameters:
      deltaMillis - millis of the time passed since last simulation tick

    • recursivelyTickSimulation

      public void recursivelyTickSimulation​(long deltaMillis)
      Recursively perform the state change for this component and all attached components, as the simulated time proceeds
      Parameters:
      deltaMillis - millis of the time passed since last simulation tick

    • dump

      public void dump()
      Dump the state to System.out.

    • recursivelyDump

      public void recursivelyDump()
      Recursively dump the state to System.out.
